body: Thanks for the pointer! Should be a quick fix, since we can replace by `BaseObject` repr in all cases where the warning is raised.
I think only needs to delete line 23 "from sklearn.base import _pprint" in file "_split.py" from sktime\forecasting\model_selection\

issue.title: [MNT] remove custom `__repr__` from `BaseSplitter`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR addresses imminent removal/change in `sklearn` `_pprint` and the private import in `sktime` `BaseSplitter`, and partially addresses #3037.

`BaseSplitter` inherits from `BaseObject` which has its own `__repr__` (from `sklearn` `BaseEstimator`), and is `BaseEstimator` compatible already, therefore the complete removal of the custom `__repr__` should address this instance of `_pprint` import.

body:
>I think only needs to delete line 23 "from sklearn.base import _pprint" in file "_split.py" from sktime\forecasting\model_selection\

Yes, that's one of the two instances and the easier one:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/3048

The other instance occurs in `benchmarking.tasks` and seems less straightforward to address, since `BaseTask` does not inherit `BaseObject`. Attempted fix here:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/3049

issue.title: [MNT] remove custom `__repr__` from `BaseTask`, inherit from `BaseObject`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR addresses imminent removal/change in `sklearn` `_pprint` and the private import in `sktime` `BaseTask`, and partially addresses #3037.

`BaseObject` has its own `__repr__` and could be used here, but `BaseTask` did not inherit from `BaseObject`.

To address the change in `__repr__`, `BaseTask` was changed to inherit from `BaseObject`, with some compatibility changes towards the `sklearn` interface. The complete removal of the custom `__repr__` in favour of `BaseObject.__repr__` should address this instance of `_pprint` import.

body: @celestinoxp, looks like we got it now. Thanks for reporting!

issue.title: [ENH] daily dev snapshot release on pypi

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
`scikit-learn` has daily dev snapshot releases on `pypi`, see here:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/3037#issuecomment-1188214203

Might be useful to also do this, so the development version install gets more accessible?
Should be possible vie adding a GitHub action.

Opinions, @lmmentel, @freddyaboulton?

I'd be in favour.

Thanks for pointing this out, @celestinoxp!

body:
>1 - Need to do some aditional tests or can close this issue?

It closes when the PR gets merged.

>2 - Exists any link to download sktime (dev or nightly or daily or snapshot) ?

We don't do dev snapshot releases, but you can always clone and pip install from source, this is just a few lines more, instructions here:
https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/installation.html#development-versions

Dev snapshots are not such a bad idea, so if you would like to add that with a PR as a GitHub workflow, it might be useful to other users!
Opened an issue here: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/3052
PS: the second PR is not merged yet, so you would have to install from the PR branch to test it.

issue.title: [ENH] support for scikit-learn 1.2

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
sktime 0.13.0 has requirement scikit-learn<1.2.0,>=0.24.0, but you have scikit-learn 1.2.dev0.

sktime 0.13.x should support future version of scikit-learn (1.2). I think we should work to support it...

more info: https://scikit-learn.org/dev/whats_new/v1.2.html
